IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Undermain Theatre is a company of artists seeking to inspire, educate and challenge audiences through its production of innovative theater.
IRS990.MissionDesc: UNDERMAIN THEATRE IS A COMPANY OF ARTISTS SEEKING TO INSPIRE, EDUCATE AND CHALLENGE AUDIENCES AND ARTISTS THROUGH ITS PRODUCTION OF INNOVATIVE THEATER WITH PARTICULAR INTEREST IN POETIC AND LANGUAGE-DRIVEN WORK.
IRS990.Desc: The Theatre produced 5 live productions Including the long delayed "He's Born, He's Borne" workshop during the year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990, SCHEDULE D, PART X, LINE 2: The Theatre is exempt from federal income taxes under Section 501(c) (3) of the Internal Revenue Code. Accordingly, no provision for income taxes is reflected in the accompanying financial statements. GAAP requires the evaluation of tax positions taken or expected to be taken in the course of preparing the Theatre's tax returns to determine whether the tax positions are more likely than not of being sustained by the applicable tax authority. Tax positions not deemed to meet the more likely than not threshold would be recorded as a tax benefit or expense in the current year. A reconciliation is not provided herein, as the beginning and ending amounts of unrecognized benefits are zero, with no interim additions, reductions, or settlements. The Theatre is relying on its tax-exempt status and its adherence to all applicable laws and regulations to preserve that status. However, the conclusions regarding accounting for uncertainty in income taxes will be subject to review and may be adjusted at a later date based on factors including, but not limited to, ongoing analysis of tax laws, regulations, and interpretations thereof. The Theatre recognizes interest and penalties, if any, related to uncertain tax positions as other expenses. The Theatre's informational returns filed are generally subject to examination for three years after the later of the due date or date of filing. As a result, the Theatre is no longer subject to income tax examinations by tax authorities for years prior to 2019.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: COMMISSION TO PLAYWRIGHT FOR A NEW WORK

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 Undermain Theatre has established the Katherine Owens - Undermain Fund for New Work (the "Fund") in memory of the Theatre's founding artistic director. The Board designated an amount to be set aside for the Fund and individual donations were received for the Fund. Commissions for New Works are recommended to the Board by the Producing Artistic Director - Bruce Dubose. The first commission was awarded in FYE July 31, 2021. Annual commissions have been awarded in October of each subsequent year. In addition in FYE 7.31.2023, a payment of $1,500 was made to an artist who helped screen potential grant recipients and a grant committee is anticipated to be established going forward.

FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B: The Form 990 is first reviewed and approved by the Finance Committee of the Board of Trustees. Then a copy of the Form 990 is provided to all of the Trustees in their Board meeting packageS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH THE POLICY
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C: ALL TRUSTEES AND KEY OFFICERS COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM AND ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY INTERESTS THAT MAY GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT ANNUALLY AND IN RESPONSE TO QUESTIONNAIRE DURING THE ANNUAL AUDIT.

form 990, part vi, line 15A&15B: The Finance Committee of the Board of Trustees reviews and approves the operating budget (including compensation for all officers and key employees) prior to the start of each fiscal year. This review includes comparison of proposed salaries to benchmarks provided in third-party published reports. The final budget is then approved by the Board of Trustees.
form 990, part vi, line 19: The Theatre's governing documents, conflict of interest policy and Financial statements are available to the public upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMMITTEE FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990, PART XII, LINE 2C: The Finance Committee engages the independent auditor, meets with them to review and approve the final version of the statements and to discuss any required disclosures and communications.
